title: A student takes a 5-item true or false test. In how many ways can she or he answer all 5 questions? - Quora

response.answer_text: The easy answer is  or 32. But this is Quora and we need to explain and visualize… The best way to represent this is with a binary tree. Each split represents a choice, and each line represents a possible outcome. Choice #1 at the top of the tree has 2 possible outcomes. The second level repeats that process with 2 possible choices and 4 possible outcomes, this repeats for all 5 levels giving us 32 possible outcomes at the bottom.

The conventional answer if 2 choices on each of 5 questions is 2^5 = 32 possible ways to answer. This ignores the fact that the student could choose not to answer some or all of the question so there are actually 3 choices T,F or No answer if this is the case there are 3^5 = 243 possible ways to answer. If the test taker can physically write an answer instead of just checking a T or F or doing nothing there are even more ways to answer the test.
